snippet: Disunity was virtually the only consistent theme to emerge from Iowa’s caucuses, and picking a candidate was based on extremely small distinctions.
abstract: David Firestone Editorial Observer notes the Iowa caucuses failed to produce a frontrunner in the Republican field of presidential candidates; asserts that voters who participated expressed significant indecision, and often voted based on minor distinctions between the candidates.
lead_paragraph: Disunity was virtually the only consistent theme to emerge from Iowa’s caucuses, and picking a candidate was based on extremely small distinctions.

headline.print_headline: Iowa’s Republicans, Divided by Gym Partitions and Conservative Ideologies
headline.seo: Iowa’s Republicans, Divided by Conservative Ideologies
headline.main: Iowa’s Republicans, Divided by Gym Partitions and Conservative Ideologies
